scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-1250 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-1250 is a star with 0.99 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located 6936.85 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.57 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-1250 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-1250 system


Kepler-1250 b

Kepler-1250 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2016-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-1250 b is 4.357 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-1250 b is 1.920 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.38, and a semi-major axis of 0.0393 astronomical units, Kepler-1250 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-1250, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-1250 - System With 1 Exoplanet
